[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GenerateFirstRoundOfNextTerm()] [Victory Manipulation] Lines 228-242 either use Election victories or fall back to current round miners. Can an attacker who controls Election contract return malicious victory list to inject unauthorized miners? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GenerateFirstRoundOfNextTerm()] [LIB Height Preservation] Lines 244-245 preserve ConfirmedIrreversibleBlockHeight from current round. Can an attacker reset these to lower values during term transition to enable chain reorganization? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GenerateFirstRoundOfNextTerm()] [ProducedBlocks Initialization] Lines 249-252 set ProducedBlocks=1 for sender or call UpdateCandidateInformation. Can sender who's not in new miner list manipulate candidate info by repeatedly triggering term transitions? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GenerateFirstRoundOfNextTerm()] [ExtraBlockProducer Assignment] Line 254 sets ExtraBlockProducerOfPreviousRound to sender. If sender is not legitimate extra block producer, can this corrupt next round's extra block logic? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GenerateFirstRoundOfNextTerm()] [BlockchainAge Calculation] Line 247 calls GetBlockchainAge. If this returns incorrect value due to timestamp manipulation, how does it affect new round parameters and miner rewards? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GenerateFirstRoundOfNextTerm()] [TryToGetVictories Side Effects] Line 228 calls TryToGetVictories which queries Election contract. Can reentrancy during this external call allow state manipulation before new round is finalized? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GenerateFirstRoundOfNextTerm()] [MiningInterval Fallback] Lines 240-241 use currentRound.GetMiningInterval() as fallback. If current round has corrupted or zero mining interval, does new term inherit broken timing? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GenerateFirstRoundOfNextTerm()] [ContainsKey Race] Line 249 checks ContainsKey before accessing. Can miner list change between check and access, causing KeyNotFoundException or allowing double-counting? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetBlockchainAge()] [Null Timestamp] Line 261 checks if BlockchainStartTimestamp is null and returns 0. Can uninitialized blockchain state be exploited to reset age-dependent parameters like miner count? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetBlockchainAge()] [Negative Age] Line 263 subtracts timestamps. If Context.CurrentBlockTime < BlockchainStartTimestamp due to manipulation, can negative age cause underflow in dependent calculations? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetBlockchainAge()] [Seconds Precision] Line 263 uses .Seconds property. Can attackers exploit millisecond-level timing to manipulate age calculations that affect miner count or reward distributions? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: TryToGetVictories()] [IsMainChain Bypass] Lines 268-272 return false if not main chain. Can side chain incorrectly set IsMainChain=true to invoke Election contract and manipulate victory results? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: TryToGetVictories()] [Election Contract Call] Line 274 makes external call to ElectionContract.GetVictories. Can malicious Election contract return empty or manipulated pubkey list to corrupt miner selection? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: TryToGetVictories()] [Empty Victories] Line 282 checks if Pubkeys.Any(). If Election returns empty victories, does caller handle false return properly, or does it cause miner list to become empty? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: TryToGetVictories()] [Logging Information Leak] Lines 275-277 log first 20 chars of pubkeys. Can this information disclosure help attackers predict or manipulate election results? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GenerateNextRoundInformation()] [MainChainMinerList Override] Lines 288-295 override miner list if IsMainChainMinerListChanged. [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GenerateNextRoundInformation()] [Miner Replacement Loop] Lines 311-339 iterate over AlternativeCandidatePubkeys. [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GenerateNextRoundInformation()] [Evil Miner Update Bypass] Lines 317-319 call UpdateCandidateInformation with isEvilNode=true. [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GenerateNextRoundInformation()] [Remove/Add Race] Lines 337-338 remove evil miner then add alternative. Can timing between these operations create temporary empty miner list, halting consensus? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GenerateNextRoundInformation()] [IsMinerListChanged Flag] Line 341 sets isMinerListChanged=true after replacements. [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GenerateNextRoundInformation()] [PreviousInValue Reset] Line 333 sets PreviousInValue to Hash.Empty. Does this break secret sharing or random number generation for the replacement miner? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GenerateNextRoundInformation()] [GetMinerReplacementInformation Trust] Lines 301-305 call GetMinerReplacementInformation with current miner list.
